channel.title: [PI]some question's -need help![PI]
channel.description:
Well.. those question i ask are those what i didn't find in this forum or in other forums. First: My defence system is messed.. like, you can wear all armor (except karil, ahrim & infinity i think) without making any defence level. [ I tryed fix this, made same code like ahrim & karil had +with some changes, everything was okey but still no defence required... so any ideas?
Second: Well when im going to attack monster and theres a wall between us, then im running trough the wall.. no clip or somehting like that? + following other players + attacking other players + moving on ladders ... ideas ?
Thx for reading. __________________ (Damn that "well" is so annoying, but still using it ^^)

item.title: [PI]some question's -need help![PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“smokin flax, post:10, topic:418463”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=521006.msg3785365#msg3785365 date=1318811764]
instead of the case, use

[b]while[/b] (item.equals("name")) { c.defenceLevelReq = #; }

The ‘if’ statement wont work, but it gives you an idea.
[/quote]
use the while statement[/quote]
The while statement wouldn’t work in this type of situation.

[quote=“smokin flax, post:12, topic:418463”]while is condintional. So, it would be
while (this is true);
then do this, or set this, etc.
so while (a = 1) {

b = 2;

etc.[/quote]
And the while statement will stop only when the true statement becomes false. like so…

while (player != null) {
System.out.println("Player is not null.");
}
//and will stop when the player becomes a null.

Find the boolean that handles the item clicking, and just add return false; or if it’s a void add return; if that player’s req doesn’t match the shit above.

Read full topic

Thnx ill try that. just a sec…
Edit: well at first i got error, then i rechange the code.(item.equals/itemName.equals)

while (itemName.equals("dharok")) { c.defenceLevelReq = 70; }
but unfortunately still dont work. : s

item.title: [PI]some question's -need help![PI]
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

while is condintional. So, it would be
while (this is true);
then do this, or set this, etc.
so while (a = 1) {

b = 2;

etc.

instead of the case, use

[code=java]
while (item.equals(“name”)) {

c.defenceLevelReq = #;

}[/code]

The ‘if’ statement wont work, but it gives you an idea.
[/quote]
use the while statement[/quote]

What i did wrong? cause i get no errors, but still it don’t need def.

The ‘if’ statement wont work, but it gives you an idea.

Any ideas? or shall I really take a new source ?-.-

item.description:

You can also do what AtomicInt_ said, but I’d rather make it so you use it as it highlights the name in your Items.CFG
